November 20, 2011: Fiction
ZERO DAY, by David Baldacci. (Grand Central, $27.99.) A military investigator
uncovers a conspiracy.
THE LITIGATORS, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $28.95.) Partners in a small
law firm take on a big case after a fast-track burnout joins them.
THE BEST OF ME, by Nicholas Sparks. (Grand Central, $25.99.) Twenty-five
years after their high school romance ended, a man and woman who have gone
their separate ways return to their North Carolina town for the funeral of a friend.
HOTEL VENDOME, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $28.) Surrounded by
fascinating guests, a woman grows up in the luxury hotel her father founded.
LOST DECEMBER, by Richard Paul Evans. (Simon & Schuster, $19.99.) A
prodigal son turns his life around during the holiday season.
1Q84, by Haruki Murakami. (Knopf, $30.5.) In 1980s Tokyo, a woman who
punishes perpetrators of domestic violence has ties to an aspiring novelist who
takes on an unusual ghostwriting project.
THE CHRISTMAS WEDDING, by James Patterson and Richard DiLallo. (Little,
Brown, $25.99.) A widow keeps the identity of the new man she is about to marry
a secret as her children gather for Christmas.
THE SNOW ANGEL, by Glenn Beck. (Threshold Editions/Mercury Radio Arts,
$21.) A woman re-evaluates her life.
OUT OF OZ, by Gregory Maguire. (Morrow/HarperCollins, $26.99.) As the land of
Oz struggles with unrest, Elphaba’s granddaughter Rain takes up her legacy;
Book 4 (the final volume) of the Wicked Years.
THE MARRIAGE PLOT, by Jeffrey Eugenides. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $28.)
Three Brown graduates in the early 1980s wrestle with love, religion and coming
of age.
THE AFFAIR, by Lee Child. (Delacorte, $28.) For Jack Reacher, an elite military
police officer, it all started in 1997. A lonely railroad track. A crime scene. A cover-
up.
THE WEDDING QUILT, by Jennifer Chiaverini. (Dutton, $25.95.) The women of
Elm Creek Manor reminisce as they create a wedding quilt for the daughter of one
of their number; an Elm Creek Quilts novel.
SHOCK WAVE, by John Sandford. (Putnam, $27.95.) Virgil Flowers investigates
several bombings of a superstore chain that seeks to open a store in a Minnesota
river town.
November 20, 2011
Non-Fiction
STEVE JOBS, by Walter Isaacson. (Simon & Schuster, $35.) A biography of the
recently deceased entrepreneur, based on 40 interviews with Jobs conducted over
two years.
KILLING LINCOLN, by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard. (Holt, $28.) The
commentator looks at the heart-stopping events surrounding the assassination of
Abraham Lincoln.
JACK KENNEDY, by Chris Matthews. (Simon & Schuster, $27.5.) An admiring
portrait.
BLUE NIGHTS, by Joan Didion. (Knopf, $25.) The writer considers her daughter’s
death in 2005.
NO HIGHER HONOR, by Condoleezza Rice. (Crown, $35.) A memoir of service
during the Bush administration.
IS EVERYONE HANGING OUT WITHOUT ME?, by Mindy Kaling. (Crown
Archetype, $25.) Observations from the comedy writer and actress.
UNBROKEN, by Laura Hillenbrand. (Random House, $27.) An Olympic runner's
story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II.
THE TIME OF OUR LIVES, by Tom Brokaw. (Random House, $26.) How to
revitalize the promise of the American dream, based on stories of Americans who
are making a difference.
BOOMERANG, by Michael Lewis. (Norton, $25.95.) A look at some of the places
— Greece, Ireland, Iceland — hardest hit by the financial collapse of 2008, and at
how it happened.
NO REGRETS, by Ace Frehley and Joe Layden. (Gallery/MTV, $26.) The KISS
guitarist recalls his life in the band.
THINKING, FAST AND SLOW, by Daniel Kahneman. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$30.) The winner of the Nobel in economic science discusses how we make
choices in business and personal life and when we can and cannot trust our
intuitions.
SERIOUSLY ... I'M KIDDING, by Ellen DeGeneres. (Grand Central, $26.99.) A
collection of humor pieces from the stand-up comedian and talk-show host.
KRIS JENNER...AND ALL THINGS KARDASHIAN, by Kris Jenner. (Gallery/Karen
Hunter, $26.) The mother and manager of the Kardashians describes her busy life
as a parent and producer.v
